segments.text: The Federal Reserve announced a 25 basis point rate cut on January 15. This was widely expected by markets.
Goldman Sachs released a report showing that inflation has dropped to 2.3 percent. The data confirms a clear downward trend since March 2024.
Some analysts suggest this could lead to further easing. Others believe rates will hold steady through the summer.
Meanwhile unemployment remains at 3.7 percent, the lowest in decades. The labor market is showing remarkable resilience.
In other news the weather today is quite pleasant and many people are enjoying the outdoors.
announced it will maintain current interest rates at 4.5 percent through the first quarter.
